Description: Scarab carved from stone; underside incised with oval (not cartouche) containing the name of Menkheperra, framed on each side by a Maat feather, above a boat (?).
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 190; Petrie 1889, pl. 61, no. 1957). The name of Menkheperra appears on a wide range of scarabs and scaraboids, and, does not necessarily refer to Thutmosis III: it was also a popular motto associated with the god Amun-Ra (Jaeger 1982, see notably 92, § 403 for this specific motif and numerous parallels). A similar scarab was discovered in Naukratis by Hogarth in 1899: Cairo, Egyptian Museum CG37371. Jaeger, B. 1982. Essai de classification et datation des scarabées Menkhéperrê. Fribourg. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W.M.F. 1889, Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically, London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 190)
Petrie 1889 / Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically (pl. 61, no. 1957)
